answers.answer: Oh, dear!  I was just celebrating at work with a handful of Brazil nuts!  Dagnabbit!It sounds like they are just being cautious, with the numbers being so close.  Now with your diet modifications and exercise -- you'll show that dratted monitor, don't you worry!Hang tight!Zilla*

I can't believe how inept some of these medical workers can be!  What if it had been the big C we were talking about...Uh, called to let you know that you don't have it YAHOO, Uh new dr, just called to let you know you do have it, I mean, this is ridiculous!  Maybe they should consider that we are human beings with feelings and they should consider that all info should be sent to the PCP so that they are not getting results from all over the bloody zoo!Let us know the next installment honey!Hugs,Rena705

If your AIC was below 7, then you are considered well within normal limits.  You have reported high glucose readings though, so I agree that this needs to be followed up by your GP.   You family history says that you are already pre-disposed to diabetes.Watch your diet carefully and maybe the high readings you have had can be controlled by diet.  Diabetes is a silent killer sweetheart, so please keep a close check on your readings.  I'd rather take a pill and watch my diet, than live a life of he l l from the results of high sugars.Hang in there hon,Heather

Hi.  I just had a glucose tolerance test and my one hour sugar was 246.  However, my Hgb A1C was 5.8 and my fasting was 79.   So my doctors chose to take the A1C number and say I am close to diabetes but not yet pre-diabetic.  Hopefully with diet and exercise I can avoid diabetes.There are two supplements that are very good for pre-diabetes.  they are Alpha Lipoic Acid  and Chromium.  I do not know how either of these would effect the Neurontin but if the doctor sees nothing wrong with them, you might want to try them.For your son, keep him off anything with High Fructose Corn Syrup.  that stuff is made to keep doctors rich.ElaineElaine

question: You will not believe this.  Just as I hit POST on this board and another board to let all of you wonderful people know I did NOT have diabetes - I may have it afterall.  Yes, they called just now and said - well Dr. so and so and his MS nurse reviewed the results themselves and feel that I need to be evaluated and looked into further as a possible diabetic by my regular physician.  Because the numbers were so close to "diabetes" (the GTT numbers) they feel more testing is in order.  But what ON EARTH more could they do?  For cryin outloud my A1c was 5.3, and that is a good number.  So, I made an appointment with my GP for next Thursday. Sorry, just feeling down again now.Thanks.
title: Dr.'s office just called - they are changing their minds (Diabetes) ???
